title: @ngrx/schematics
contents:
mode_edit

@ngrx/schematicslink

Scaffolding library for Angular applications using NgRx libraries.

Schematics provides Angular CLI commands for generating files when building new NgRx feature areas and expanding existing ones. Built on top of Schematics, this tool integrates with the Angular CLI.

Installationlink

Detailed installation instructions can be found on the Installation page.

Dependencieslink

After installing @ngrx/schematics, install the NgRx dependencies.

npm install @ngrx/{store,effects,entity,store-devtools} --save yarn add @ngrx/{store,effects,entity,store-devtools}

Initial State Setuplink

Generate the initial state management and register it within the app.module.ts

ng generate @ngrx/schematics:store State --root --module app.module.ts
The @ngrx/schematics command prefix is only needed when the default collection isn't set.

Initial Effects Setuplink

Generate the root effects and register it within the app.module.ts

ng generate @ngrx/schematics:effect App --root --module app.module.ts

Adding NgRx schematics to schematicCollectionslink

To use @ngrx/schematics in your Angular CLI project, add it manually to your angular.json or with the following command:

ng config cli.schematicCollections "[\"@ngrx/schematics\"]"

You should end up with the following result in your angular.json:

{ "cli": { "schematicCollections": ["@ngrx/schematics"] } }

Or, when the Angular schematic is also registered you should end up with following result:

{ "cli": { "schematicCollections": ["@schematics/angular", "@ngrx/schematics"], } }

The collection schema also has aliases to the most common schematics used to generate files.
